intro: Tarenna dallachiana subsp. dallachiana, commonly known as the Dallachian tarenna, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, elliptic leaves with smooth margins. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals, and it produces small, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
